00014 #define ASC2HEX(x) ( ((x >= '0') && (x <= '9')) ? \
00015                                       (x - '0') : \
00016                      ((x >= 'A') && (x <= 'F')) ? \
00017                                  (x - 'A' + 10) : \
00018                      ((x >= 'a') && (x <= 'f')) ? \
00019                              (x - 'a' + 10) : 0 )
00020 
00021 #define HEX(x, i) (BYTE)(((x[i/2] >> ((i & 1) ? 0 : 4)) & 0x0F))

00042 /******************************************************************************
00043 CDMA SERVICE MACRO MASK_B
00044 
00045 DESCRIPTION
00046    Masks the number of bits give by length starting at the given offset.
00047    Unlike MASK and MASK_AND_SHIFT, this macro only creates that mask, it
00048    does not operate on the data buffer.
00049 ******************************************************************************/
00050 #define MASK_B(offset, len) \
00051   ((0xff >> offset) & (0xff << (8 - (offset + len))))

00133 /* CDMA SMS decoding defines */
00134 #define  MAX( x, y ) ( ((x) > (y)) ? (x) : (y) )
00135 #define _T(x) L ## x

00137 /**********************************************************
00138 MACRO bitsize
00139 
00140 DESCRIPTION
00141    Computes size in bits of the specified data type.
00142 **********************************************************/
00143 #define bitsize(type) (sizeof(type) * 8)
00144 #define MAX_SMSI_TL_ADDRESS  50 // Maximum SMS address length
00145 #define MAX_SMSI_CALL_BACK   32 // Maximum SMS callback length
00146 
00147 /**********************************************************
00148 MACRO copymask
00149 
00150 DESCRIPTION
00151    Creates a mask of bits sized to the number of bits in the given type.
00152 **********************************************************/
00153 #define copymask(type) ((0xffffffff) >> (32 - bitsize(type)))
00154 
00155 /******************************************************************************
00156 MACRO MASK
00157 
00158 DESCRIPTION
00159    Masks the bits in data at the given offset for given number of width bits.
00160 ******************************************************************************/
00161 #define MASK(width, offset, data) \
00162     /*lint -e701 shift left  of signed quantity  */  \
00163     /*lint -e702 shift right of signed quantity  */  \
00164     /*lint -e572 Excessive shift value           */  \
00165     /*lint -e573 Signed-unsigned mix with divide */  \
00166     /*lint -e506 Constant value boolean          */  \
00167     /*lint -e649 Sign fill during constant shift */  \
00168                                                      \
00169    (((width) == bitsize(data)) ? (data) :   \
00170    ((((copymask(data) << (bitsize(data) - ((width) % bitsize(data)))) \
00171     & copymask(data)) >>  (offset)) & (data))) \
00172                      \
00173     /*lint +e701 */  \
00174     /*lint +e702 */  \
00175     /*lint +e572 */  \
00176     /*lint +e573 */  \
00177     /*lint +e506 */  \
00178     /*lint +e649 */
00179 
00180 
00181 /******************************************************************************
00182 MACRO MASK_AND_SHIFT
00183 
00184 DESCRIPTION
00185    Same as the macro MASK except also shifts the data in the result by the
00186    given number of shift bits.
00187 *******************************************************************************/
00188 #define MASK_AND_SHIFT(width, offset, shift, data)  \
00189     /*lint -e504 Unusual shifter value */  \
00190                   ((((signed) (shift)) < 0) ?       \
00191                     MASK((width), (offset), (data)) << -(shift) :  \
00192                     MASK((width), (offset), (data)) >>  (((unsigned) (shift)))) \
00193     /*lint +e504 */
00194

00396 /*
00397  * QCWWAN_STRUCT_SMS_CdmaHeader - CDMA SMS Header
00398  *
00399  * this structure defines the header of incoming
00400  * SMS messages. Most of the data items are
00401  * defined in the CDMA specification and are not
00402  * explained here. The enumerated types are
00403  * described following this structure.
00404  *
00405  * sizeStruct    - size of this structure
00406  *
00407  * eParamMask    - Parameter Mask indicating which of the below fields
00408  *                are valid.  See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_ParamMask.
00409  *
00410  * eMsgCategory  - Message Category
00411  *                 See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_MsgCategory
00412  *
00413  * eTeleservice  - Message Teleservice
00414  *                 See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_Teleservice
00415  *
00416  * serviceCategory - Service Category (News, Restaraunts, etc.)
00417  *                   Refer to TIA/EIA-637 Section 3.4.3.2 for more detail.
00418  *
00419  * tlAckReq        - Indicates if the client needs to confirm
00420  *                   whether the message is received successfully or not.
00421  *
00422  * eMsgIdType      - Message ID Type
00423  *                   See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_MsgIdType
00424  *
00425  * addrDigitMode   - Address Digit Mode
00426  *
00427  * addrNumMode     - Address number mode
00428  *
00429  * addrNumType     - Address number type:
00430  *                   GSM SMS: addr value is GSM 7-bit chars
00431  *                   if NumMode == 0
00432  *                   WMS_NUMBER_UNKNOWN        = 0,
00433  *                   WMS_NUMBER_INTERNATIONAL  = 1,
00434  *                   WMS_NUMBER_NATIONAL       = 2,
00435  *                   WMS_NUMBER_NETWORK        = 3,
00436  *                   WMS_NUMBER_SUBSCRIBER     = 4,
00437  *                   WMS_NUMBER_ALPHANUMERIC   = 5,
00438  *                   WMS_NUMBER_ABBREVIATED    = 6,
00439  *                   WMS_NUMBER_RESERVED_7     = 7,
00440  *                   if NumMode == 1
00441  *                   WMS_NUMBER_DATA_IP        = 1
00442  *                   WMS_NUMBER_INTERNET_EMAIL = 2
00443  *
00444  * addrNumPlan      - Address number plan
00445  *                    CCITT E.164 and E.163, including ISDN plan
00446  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_UNKNOWN     = 0,
00447  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_TELEPHONY   = 1,
00448  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_RESERVED_2  = 2,
00449  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_DATA        = 3, :CCITT X.121
00450  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_TELEX       = 4, :CCITT F.69
00451  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_RESERVED_5  = 5,
00452  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_RESERVED_6  = 6,
00453  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_RESERVED_7  = 7,
00454  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_RESERVED_8  = 8,
00455  *                    WMS_NUMBER_PLAN_PRIVATE     = 9,
00456  *
00457  * addrLen          - Length of Address
00458  *
00459  * szAddress        - Destination address if we are sending out a MO SMS
00460  *                    Origination address if we are retrieving a MT SMS
00461  *
00462  * subType          - Sub address type
00463  *
00464  * subOdd           - Sub Address Odd byte
00465  *
00466  * subLen           - Length of the sub-address
00467  *
00468  * szSubAddress     - Destination sub-address if we are sending out a MO SMS
00469  *                    Origination sub-address if we are retrieving a MT SMS
00470  *
00471  * callBackLen      - Length of the Callback number
00472  *
00473  * szCallBack       - String containing the Call Back number with a 32 maximum characters
00474  *
00475  * ePriority        - Message Priority
00476  *                    See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_Priority
00477  *
00478  * ePrivacy         - Message Privacy Level
00479  *                    See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_Privacy
00480  *
00481  * eLanguage        - Message Language
00482  *                    See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_Language
00483  *
00484  * user_ack_req     - Specify whether user Acknowledgement is required
00485  *                    True/False
00486  *
00487  * dak_req          - Specify whether delivery acknowledge is required.
00488  *
00489  * userResp         - User Response Code
00490  *
00491  * szNumMsg         - Number of Voice messages (SMSI_VMN_95) on the network
00492  *
00493  * deliveryAlert    - Alert on Delivery
00494  *
00495  * dataEncoding     - Message Body Data Encoding.
00496  *                   Refer to QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_DataEncodeType.
00497  *
00498  * ts_yr            - Time Stamp Year - the value is presented
00499  *                    in decimal format.
00500  *
00501  * ts_mon           - Time Stamp Month - the value is presented
00502  *                    in hexadecimal format.
00503  *                    E.g. December will be interpreted as 0x12
00504  *
00505  * ts_day           - Time Stamp Day- the value is presented in
00506  *                    hexadecimal format.
00507  *                    E.g. 30th will be interpreted as 0x30.
00508  *
00509  * ts_hrs           - Time Stamp Hour - the value is presented in
00510  *                    hexadecimal format.
00511  *                    E.g. eleven o'clock is presented as 0x0x11.
00512  *                    Represented in 24-hour time.
00513  *
00514  * ts_min           - Time Stamp Minute - the value is presented
00515  *                    in hexadecimal format.
00516  *                    E.g. thirty minute is presented as 0x30.
00517  *
00518  * ts_sec           - Time Stamp Second - the value is presented
00519  *                    in hexadecimal format.
00520  *                    E.g. thirty minute is presented as 0x30.
00521  *
00522  * abVal_yr         - Absolute Validity Year - the value is
00523  *                    presented in decimal format.
00524  *
00525  * abVal_mon        - Absolute Validity Month - the value is
00526  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00527  *                    E.g. December will be interpreted as 0x12.
00528  *
00529  * abVal_day        - Absolute Validity Day- the value is presented
00530  *                    in hexadecimal format.
00531  *                    E.g. 30th will be interpreted as 0x30.
00532  *
00533  * abVal_hrs        - Absolute Validity Hour - the value is
00534  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00535  *                    E.g. eleven o'clock is presented as 0x0x11.
00536  *                    Represented in 24-hour time.
00537  *
00538  * abVal_min        - Absolute Validity Minute - the value is
00539  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00540  *                    Thus, thirty minute is presented as 0x30.
00541  *
00542  * abVal_sec        - Absolute Validity Second - the value is
00543  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00544  *                    E.g. thirty minute is presented as 0x30.
00545  *
00546  * relVal_time      - Relative Validity Time of a SMS transmission.
00547  *                    See TIA/EIA 637-A Section 4.5.6 for more detail.
00548  *
00549  * abDef_yr         - Absolute Delivery Deferral Year - the value is
00550  *                    presented in decimal format.
00551  *
00552  * abDef_mon        - Absolute Delivery Deferral Month - the value is
00553  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00554  *                    E.g. December will be interpreted as 0x12.
00555  *
00556  * abDef_day        - Absolute Delivery Deferral Day - the value is presented
00557  *                    in hexadecimal format.
00558  *                     E.g. 30th will be interpreted as 0x30.
00559  *
00560  * abDef_hrs        - Absolute Delivery Deferral Hour - the value is
00561  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00562  *                    E.g. eleven o'clock is presented as 0x0x11.
00563  *                    Represented in 24-hour time.
00564  *
00565  * abDef_min        - Absolute Delivery Deferral Minute - the value is
00566  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00567  *                    E.g. thirty minute is presented as 0x30.
00568  *
00569  * abDef_sec        - Absolute Delivery Deferral Second - the value is
00570  *                    presented in hexadecimal format.
00571  *                    E.g. thirty minute is presented as 0x30.
00572  *
00573  * relDef_time      - Relative Delivery Deferral Time of a SMS transmission.
00574  *                    See Reference 1 Section 4.5.8 for more detail.
00575  *
00576  * eMsgDispMode     - Message Display Mode:
00577  *                    See QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_MsgDispMode
00578  *
00579  */
00580 typedef struct
00581 {
00582     ULONG                        sizeStruct;
00583     QCWWAN_TYPE_SMS_ParamMask    eParamMask;

00632 
00633 /*
00634  * QCWWAN_STRUCT_CDMA_SMS_RetrieveSms - SMS Retrieve structure
00635  * This structure is used to provide input to, and
00636  * receive output from the SwiRetrieveSMSMessage function.
00637  *
00638  * sizeStruct       - size of this structure
00639  *
00640  * sHeader          - The SMS header for this message.
00641  *
00642  * nSMSId           - The message ID number assigned by
00643  *                      the network.
00644  *
00645  * cntRemainingSMS  - The number of SMS
00646  *                      messages remaining in the modem (all three
00647  *                      queues combined).
00648  *
00649  * pMessage         - A pointer provided by the application
00650  *                      in which to place the body of the SMS
00651  *                      message.
00652  *
00653  * sizeBuffer       - The length in bytes of the buffer
00654  *                    supplied to receive the body of the SMS message.
00655  *                    This should be based on the maximum size of
00656  *                    message supported by the network. The API
00657  *                    currently supports up to 240 bytes, although
00658  *                    most networks limit this to a lower value.
00659  *                    retrievedStatus For future use; ignore.
00660  *                    On return , this parameter will be set to the
00661  *                    no. of bytes copied into the pMessage buffer
00662  *
00663  */
00664 typedef struct
00665 {
00666     ULONG                     sizeStruct;
00667     BOOL                      bUnreadSMS;      /* Not used */
00668     QCWWAN_STRUCT_SMS_CdmaHeader sHeader;
00669     WORD                      nSMSId;
00670     ULONG                     cntRemainingSMS;
00671     BYTE                      *pMessage;
00672     ULONG                     sizeBuffer;
00673     ULONG                     retrievedStatus;  /* Not used */
00674 }QCWWAN_STRUCT_CDMA_SMS_RetrieveSms;
